Question: Can I delete my old calendar history?

Rag_Rain_comp: Yes, you can manage your contacts in the "Your Account" section of the website. You can add, update, or delete contacts. If you don't want Alexa to call or message your contacts, you can disable the feature in the Alexa app.

Question: Can I hide my email address?

Question: I want to change my name.

Question: Can you delete my voice recordings?
Rag_Rain_comp: Yes, you can delete your voice recordings one by one, by date range, by Alexa-enabled device, or all at once. You can also choose to have your voice recordings older than 3 or 18 months deleted automatically. If you choose not to save any voice recordings, we will automatically delete your voice recordings after we process your requests and all of the voice recordings currently in your Voice History as well.

Question: Does the company share user's contacts' information with a third party?

Question: How do you process my audio recordings?
Rag_Rain_comp: When you speak to Alexa, a recording of what you asked Alexa is sent to Amazon's cloud, where we process your request and other information to respond to you. For example, when you ask, "Alexa, play top hits on Amazon Music," we use the recording of your request and information from Amazon Music to play top hits. We also use your recordings to improve Alexa's speech recognition and natural language understanding systems using machine learning. This training relies in part on supervised machine learning, where humans review an extremely small sample of requests to help Alexa understand the correct interpretation of a request and provide the appropriate response in the future.

Question: Does the assistant turn on my mic without my knowledge?
Rag_Rain_comp: No, the assistant does not turn on your mic without your knowledge. The device detects the wake word by identifying acoustic patterns that match the wake word.
